misconceptions.inferred_category_name: Correct Implementation of Single Array Shift
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that the provided logic for shifting (`int last = arr[n-1]; for (int i = n - 1; i > 0; i--) { arr[i] = arr[i - 1]; } arr[0] = last;`) is the standard and correct algorithm for performing a single right circular shift on an array. The student successfully implemented the canonical solution for this task.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: There is no conceptual gap related to the task. The student correctly applies the required steps: saving the element that shifts off the end, iterating backward to avoid overwriting elements before they are used, and placing the saved element at the beginning.
